messages.subject: Quote
messages.msgSnippet: Education is knowing where to go to find out what you need to know, and it s knowing how to use the information you get. not sure who it s by just saw it the
messages.messageBody:
"Education is knowing where to go to find out what you need to know,
and it's knowing how to use the information you get."

not sure who it's by just saw it the other day and I liked it :)

Sonya
Attleboro,Mass.

messages.subject: Quote
messages.msgSnippet: Just found a great quote from the HEM newsletter and wanted to share. I suppose it is because nearly all children go to school nowadays and have things
messages.messageBody:
Just found a great quote from the HEM newsletter and wanted to share.


"I suppose it is because nearly all children go to school nowadays and have
things arranged for them that they seem so forlornly unable to produce their
own ideas."

Agatha Christie

messages.subject: Quote
messages.msgSnippet: Olivia said: But you know the old saying you can lead a horse to water but you can t make him drink.  I guess you could change that and say you can lead a
messages.messageBody:
Olivia said:
But you know the old saying "you can lead a horse to water but you can't
make
him drink." I guess you could change that and say "you can lead a child to
school but you can't make him think."

Hey, that's cool! Can I quote that on my unschooling page?? ~Eryn

==
"I dreamed I was a butterfly, flitting around in the sky;
then I awoke. Now I wonder: Am I a man who dreamt of
being a butterfuly, or am I a butterfly dreaming that I am
a man?" - Chuang Tsu
http://www.camenaworks.com/Eryn/
#24591173 ::she just is::
AIM :: Opal Fayre
